_comment: TODO: Review all translations for user-friendliness and accuracy

app.title: TempBin - Temporary File Sharing
app.description: Share files securely with links that expire automatically

header.github: Visit kazeochan on GitHub (opens in new tab)

hero.title: Share Files Temporarily
hero.subtitle: Upload your files and we'll create a shareable link that expires in {{minutes}} minute
hero.subtitle_plural: Upload your files and we'll create a shareable link that expires in {{minutes}} minutes

hashFilename.label: Hide Filenames
hashFilename.hint: Encrypt filenames to protect your privacy

upload.title: Drag your files here
upload.subtitle: or click to select
upload.ariaLabel: Upload file area. Click to select a file or drag and drop a file here

fileList.title: Files
fileList.copyAllLinksAria: Copy all file links to clipboard
fileList.name: Name

empty.title: No files yet
empty.subtitle: Upload your first file to get started

settings.title: Settings
settings.infoTitle: Set up your Cloudflare R2 storage
settings.infoDescription: You'll need your R2 credentials from the Cloudflare dashboard. Don't worry, all data is stored only in your browser.
settings.publicUrlHint: Custom domain for public file access
settings.storageLimitHint: Set your monthly storage limit (Free plan: 10 GB)
settings.requiredFields: Please fill in all required fields
settings.clearDataConfirm: Are you sure you want to clear all data? This action cannot be undone.

validation.invalidAccountId: Account ID format is incorrect (needs 32 hex characters)
validation.bucketNameLength: Bucket name must be between 3 and 63 characters
validation.bucketNameChars: Only lowercase letters, numbers, and hyphens allowed
validation.bucketNameHyphen: Bucket name cannot start or end with a hyphen
validation.invalidAccessKeyId: Access Key ID format is incorrect (needs 32 hex characters)
validation.invalidSecretAccessKey: Secret Access Key format is incorrect (needs 64 hex characters)
validation.invalidUrlProtocol: URL must start with http:// or https://

welcome.title: Welcome to TempBin
welcome.subtitle: Let's set up your Cloudflare R2 storage.

step1.title: Account & Bucket
step1.description: Enter your Cloudflare Account ID and the R2 Bucket Name you want to use.

instructions.title: How to find these?
instructions.step1: Log in to your Cloudflare dashboard.
instructions.step2: Navigate to R2 from the sidebar.
instructions.step3: Your Account ID is shown on the right side of the R2 overview page.
instructions.step4: Create a new bucket or use an existing one and copy its name.

step2.title: Credentials
step2.description: Enter your R2 Access Key ID and Secret Access Key.

instructions.title: How to generate keys?
instructions.step1: In the R2 dashboard, click on 'Manage R2 API Tokens' on the right.
instructions.step4: Create the token and copy the Access Key ID and Secret Access Key.

step3.title: Public Access
step3.description: Optionally configure a custom domain for public file access.

instructions.title: Setting up public access
instructions.step1: Go to your bucket settings in the R2 dashboard.
instructions.step2: Under 'Public Access', you can connect a custom domain or allow public access via R2.dev subdomain.
instructions.step3: Enter the full URL (e.g., https://files.example.com) here.

step4.title: Storage Limit
step4.description: Set a storage limit to help you manage your R2 usage and costs.

instructions.title: About Storage Limits
instructions.step1: Cloudflare R2 offers a generous free plan (10 GB/month).
instructions.step2: Set a limit here and we'll warn you before you exceed it.
instructions.step3: This is just a browser-side check and won't enforce limits on Cloudflare.

step5.title: CORS Setup
step5.description: Configure Cross-Origin Resource Sharing (CORS) so you can upload files from this website.

instructions.title: How to set up CORS
instructions.step1: Go to your bucket settings in the R2 dashboard.
instructions.step4: Paste it into the CORS Policy editor and save.

step5.pasteHint: Paste this into your R2 bucket's CORS policy settings.

step6.title: Auto-Delete Setup
step6.description: Set up auto-delete rules so files are automatically removed after 24 hours.

instructions.title: How to set up auto-delete
instructions.step1: Go to your bucket settings in the R2 dashboard.
instructions.step3: Add a rule to expire objects after 1 day (or your preferred duration).
instructions.step4: This way, files will be deleted from the server even if you close the page.

completion.title: All Set!
completion.subtitle: Your R2 storage is configured and ready to use.

limit.title: Storage Limit About to Be Exceeded
limit.message: Uploading these files will exceed your storage limit.

notifications.uploadError: Upload failed. Please check your R2 settings.
